metadata.title: CVE-2018-12178 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in network stack for EDK II may allow unprivileged user topotentially enable escalation of privilege and/or denial of service vianetwork.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12178` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ovmf - 0~20190606.20d2e5a1-1ubuntu2
qemu-efi - 0~20190606.20d2e5a1-1ubuntu2
qemu-efi-aarch64 - 0~20190606.20d2e5a1-1ubuntu2
qemu-efi-arm - 0~20190606.20d2e5a1-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: edk2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0~20190606.20d2e5a1-1ubuntu2').
